javadoc:
Stores ranges of short values throughout "long" space.
 Every "long" index has an associated short value (initially 0).
 Users can paint (set) ranges of indexes to a given short integer value, 
 overwriting any value that currently exists in that range.
 
 This class is implemented using an ShortPropertySet.  The first index
 (0) will always contain a value.  The value at any other given
 index will either be the value stored at that index, or if no
 value stored there, then the value stored at the nearest previous index
 that contains a value.

methods.name: paintRange
methods.comment:
Associates the given value with every index from start to end (inclusive)
 Any previous associates are overwritten.

params.name: start
params.comment: the start index of the range to fill.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end index of the range to fill

params.name: value
params.comment: the value to put at every index in the range.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the short value associated with the given index.
@param index the index at which to get the value.
methods.name: getValue
methods.comment: Returns the short value associated with the given index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index at which to get the value.

methods.name: getIndexRangeIterator
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all occupied ranges in the map.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to start the iterator

return.comment: an iterator over all occupied ranges in the map.

methods.name: getChangePointIterator
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all indexes where the value changes.

return.comment: an iterator over all indexes where the value changes.

name: ShortRangeMap
comment:
Stores ranges of short values throughout "long" space.
 Every "long" index has an associated short value (initially 0).

fields.javadoc: The maximum end of range index allowed.
fields.name: LARGEST
fields.comment: The maximum end of range index allowed.
